koEr9S7YMhOvjusqhxDlzw.text: Gotta love this spot!  Place is super spacious. Occasional live music on Fridays, some pool and pingpong tables, great beer selection and some comfort bar food...what else you need?  Staff is very friendly. Security is most of the time super alert to spot very drunk ones out there.  Prices are normal for a bar.   Plus, they are able to manage comfortable temperature during hot summers. Very important!

rLD9t97jHMmRopRWYOJtHw.text: Great ambiance, good food and cocktails. I usually tend to end up here for the live music

pPkBb2uLxKqxywol9lvVCw.text: How does Boondocks only have a 3.5 rating? I'll tell you how -- chuckleheads. Chuckleheads as far as the eye can see. I am in a sea of chuckleheads. All I see in this sea with my eye is chuckleheads.   This place slaps. Great set-up; open air, pool tables, that basketball shot game thing that is in every arcade, a stage for live music, TVs, etc. It is great for people that enjoy having fun and doing things and being fun people that do fun things.  Also, this bar has alcohol, which is a huge plus. Also also, it is way easier to get an uber from here than elsewhere in Old Town, which is also a plus.  Overall, this place isn't radically innovative or exotic. But, it doesn't need to be. It provides a necessary alternative to the typical Old Town bar/wanna-be club. And it does this very well.

HBiYxXfdyg_NQ_OCLJVzzQ.text: Was here during bachelor party golf weekend. Came on a Saturday eve/night. Bar staff were not very attentive and took forever to get drinks even when we had their attention. Finally getting a seat and it was filthy and not wiped down, then people in standing room areas were so close to our table it was like having someone's @ss right in your face. There's an uncovered area (outside) where smoking is allowed but due to the downdraft all the smoke comes inside and the place stinks.   The servers in and around the tables were also not very friendly at all. Drink orders were wrong a few times, or forgotten completely. I was charged for a few drinks we never ordered and one of my friends' tabs took 45 min to close out...just a poor experience and a loud annoying one at that. Next time in town I won't waste my time here.

4hk3M9lgLee6h8gStw-BPA.text: Do not go here! The bartenders refuse to give itemize receipts and will over change you if you're not sober! They over charged us multiple beers. The worst bar in old town! Not to mention that the management was absolutely worthless and just smiled in my face the entire time after over charging us. Do not come to this bar!!!

3qw5mZSV_5fuS_ESro1tZA.text: I love this bar! I live at The Stetson which is less than 50 yards from it, so I'm here quite often! Food is definitely good - I order it all the time. The only major downfall for me is that they don't have many TVs to watch games on unfortunately. It's a great place to go with a huge group of friends nonetheless. They have tons of games to play, too... pool, table tennis, corn hole, darts, pop-a-shot, ski ball, etc! DEFINITELY come here for a bite to eat and some fun as well. #Boonies

_wUuCZ9U7hG_lp58d6FoZw.text: Fun Hangout Spot   Boondocks is a fun, unassuming bar that offers a nice break from the rowdier party scene. There are a number of bar games (pool, darts, skier ball, hoops etc.) to play with your friends, and the ambience is cool. I've had the hamburger, grilled chicken salad, and steak pita, which were all decent. The standard bar fare is probably your best bet. My friends and I frequent here a good amount, and we always have a good time!

photos.caption: Photo of Boondocks Patio & Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gj0UxLUekbDsMC3lXtMySA.text: This place is fun! Corn hole, Kenya and other games are available to play with. The food was excellent had a burger and it was made perfect. Drink specials are cheap and well worth it! Great place day or night

qGjpSqOW-wkWqP6ozHYKvg.text: Wish it still had the pool!  That way I would forget about the food that was served here and just keep having fun.  In its defense, if your looking for something just outside of the old town madness but still willing to pay a premium for drinks and so so food, this is the spot!  You are sure to get a seat here every time no matter the night or occasion.  Just be sure you remember the location if you plan on coming back in a year as this place will most likely be named something new.  Most places in old town try to revamp themselves into new and exciting places yet this one fell short again as did its neighbor.  In the 2 years I have been going out in old town Scottsdale these 2 locations will have been 5 different names between the 2 of them!

oE09Km-MBMZFx_CRe-ptGQ.text: Free Ping Pong and Pool.  Little more pricy than other bars but not bad for scottsdale.

nGUbBa7bpGB1-2jzDh3evQ.text: Best place in Old Town for playing games on an outdoor patio. Staff is fun and there is plenty of room for bringing a big group. That said I've come to watch a game by myself and ended up making several friends at the bar. It has that local hangout kind of vibe that makes it my go to spot for a casual beer.The crowd is pretty mixed and friendly. Wednesday night is county night and a lot of fun. There is live music occasionally with pretty talented musicians. Somehow ended up here on a Saturday night and the ENTIRE bar was singing Michael Jackson songs for some sort of retro night while dancing. Two other times a random pub crawl rolled through in costumes. Seems to always be something fun going on here. Oh, the Pork Belly BLT is AWESOME. Staff is great and seem to know everyone too.

U6eyI5Am5fN8pYjzRhPMFw.text: Amazing food, so glad I came here on a Wednesday night once again.  Stopped by for the tacos and  have now found out they have an amazing country night on Wednesdays! Great place ,  keep up the good work guys.  Will be back soon!

Y7pqzTtVr-F2q60tLPC-CA.text: Nice set up, generally cool staff, decent selection of drinks...haven't gone beyond the pretzles though food wise.  The prices are old town Snottsdale style but the people are what make it into Scottsdale classy but chill.   If they were like my usual haunt price wise, I might be  more regular.

vFxSIUPvAN65kCjoR2BM3A.text: Simply a great bar and a refreshing change from most of the stuff down in old town. Actually has good food and we'll made drinks with a nice relaxed patio with lots of fun activities.

WjeuVG9WRRcon-xHtA22Ww.text: Love this place ! The bartenders are ALWAYS extremely friendly and very awesome!! I would highly recommended this place! Awesome service !! For someone to "NOT BE SERVED" AND "IGNORED" ..they must have been biligerant and/or inappropriate.

13n9Aende3dbqxdEcP8nTA.text: Had The Blue Cheese Burger with egg and very good. Wie had the hot dog with coleslaw on it. She almost did not get the dog because of the slaw, but after tasting it she said was the best hot dog she ever had because of the slaw. Sat at the bar and it was a good experience all around.

ZgqKz1VR18YBRWaVKSLR9w.text: Great out door patio area with a large tv screen. Trivia on Wednesday nights is fun. Unfortunately I ordered the nachos per my servers recommendation. They looked tasty , but after one bite I could tell the cheese they used was the cheese you get with ballpark nachos. I was extremely disappointed. Would recommend going here to drink, but I do not recommend the food.

3k43OXxmd3Pb1w3cGvyPEA.text: This is by far the coolest and most original bar in town. The management especially Matt Olms make this my bar of choice and the only establishment I will frequent in old town. The food has a broad menu from gourmet salads to burgers! I think I've tried everything on the menu and haven't had a bad meal yet! Ask for Matt and tell him brandon sent you!

lkkeare7fMODUQkC5vlGNw.text: My charity group hosted an event here a couple of weeks ago and they were really great; everyone had a good time.  I came back last Sunday because I remembered that they allow dogs on the patio and I had my pup with me.  I met a friend for a quick bite and a glass of wine and we had the best afternoon.  Not only was every single employee extremely friendly, they brought out cute little dog treats that looked like cookies and a bucket of ice water for my dog.  Our bartender even found an iPhone charger and plugged in my phone, which had died.  The food is much better than your typical bar fare and they have very reasonably priced wine on tap.  Overall, it was a great experience; I will be back more often!

9bCrPc_5j7OboiO3ID68Tg.text: Our server Michael was amazing!  It was our first time there and got there right when it opened.  We brought our dog Teagan with us since they have a pet friendly patio.  Patio was huge and had lots of fun games if you so desired.  We each ordered the Bacon Bleu Burger.  I had a Orange Blossom beer and my boyfriend had the Double D IPA.  The burgers were delicious, they brought out ice water in a tin bucket for our pooch right away and Michael was very attentive and knowledgeable about their beer selections.  We will definitely recommend this place and visit again!

EZmRcLyOQ78sHp8n-8RjYQ.text: Went on a Sunday with friends, waited forever to get our order taken at our table so we got up and ordered from the bar. They ran out of fireball throughout the day, and the bathroom had lights that were out making it extremely difficult to see, and there was no hand soap. After we told an employee about the bathroom, they informed the manager who didn't seem to care.

7dIXFmScOaNMWU8dIpk8pQ.text: Great concept.  Have gone to Boondocks for over 10 times now.   Love that you can go inside when you want (summer) and outside for 9 1/2 months out of the year.  Also its a place that gives you option for activities.  Pool, Ping Ping, Sack Toss etc.... And provides the room to do it.     Food is a little pricing for a lunch menu but worth it.  Beers on tap are interesting.  Mixing it up.  Really cool.  Service has been great.  No complaints at all.  Dog friendly is cool.  They take care of the patrons with dogs with ice and water.  Nice touch.    I read some of the other reviews.  Some of them either sound like they are auditioning for Secret Shoppers/Diners or they work for competing venues in Old Town.    Thanks Boondocks (for being so new but a refreshing change to what else is out there).

NO2xvJ7c68D3vf7WJQZ2Mw.text: This place has great potential.   But when the bartenders ignore you and it's impossible to get a drink on a Sunday night, that is defiantly a turn off.    If you want to order a drink here, make sure you look like the cast of jersey shore.  Also, they have three bar stations, but only one open with only two (terrible) bartenders working it??? We went the night before Labor Day, so it should have been staffed much more.    If they simply had decent bar tenders and enough of them for the size of the establishment, it would be great.    Pool, corn hole, and darts.  What's not to love? Work on your service!!!! Until then, we will not be back.

-H9lzktaUg7VqP3pQ2pENQ.text: Really nice to find a bar with people country dancing in old town. I went on a Wednesday night and it was surprisingly busy. They played country music 95% of the time, and they had entertaining dancing contests that kept me entertained. My friends all had a nice time.

uOODwO0L6_Wy-vcNySn6uQ.text: Nice bar! We came here for beers but there are games and good looking food. We would definitely come here again. Good music too!!

YXecJhly0r2qhiyKxphx0w.text: The best "regular" bar in old Town. Such a chill place to go especially for anyone new to the area. Every time I've gone there is such a good energy and the bands they hire are really good.

udoXS5_JMSrWpEOuUaqrWw.text: pretty sweet place from what I remember.....whether it was the excess tequila or the place itself, I do remember having a great time. Lots to do (pop-a-shot, bags, darts, etc..) lots of space, good drinks, friendly staff. Will be back for another night to not remember.

k982z0h8Tmhu3Ih583ypBA.text: I love Yelp and I use it everyday. Plus you have the hottest chicks working thereAnd the really smart to.

tHylSbkGIa9iQLnpMH4HrQ.text: Love this places outdoor atmosphere. We came here for a college basketball game and they accommodated our team. So we begin and ordering food, first appetizer was delicious. Brussels sprouts that are heaven to our sinful mouth then we order chicken nachos and wait..... And wait...... And wait.... And wait...... When we asked Stephanie (our server) she thought we ate them already, that's how long we waited! She actually acted like someone else had them, until we asked another server and the order was never put in in.... So the plot thickens.... They arrived cold and extremely underwhelming. Not sure if I come back but it's worth at least some Brussels sprouts

DJvG_fG2oJCXbXAEgYHqrg.text: Love Boondocks! Staff is friendly, cheese curds are bomb, PBR tall boys always in stock. Great low key bar.

a5QiPzKizdFyLWXM0R7pOg.text: This place is great. Especially if you have a decent size group. I would highly recommend anyone looking for a good bar scene

2QbxXc-2Ylz71QkDV98VgQ.text: So much fun. Tons of activities on the patio. Lots of Tvs and one huge one for games. The staff is really polite and attentive and the service has always been consistent. Hands down my favorite bar in Scottsdale!

COq2mkIip50V2dQyMwu9Jw.text: Great place! Had my friends birthday party here and the staff did a great job putting everything together and the owner stopped by to see how things were going. Food is good unlike most bars in the area and their drinks are priced good.   Thanks to the Boondocks staff for making it a great evening!

J6ZGqTCBHDEMkP3gn_g-qA.text: I won't say for sure that this place is a racist establishment, but it sure seemed that way. I wish I could give it negative stars. My dad and brother were in town so we went here to grab some burgers and beers. The beer buckets came out relatively quick, but we waited for our food for OVER AN HOUR before deciding to leave for another burger joint. Yes, that's right, OVER AN HOUR and the food STILL hadn't come out. We ordered 4 burgers and I was starting to wonder if they had to go out and slaughter the cows or something, it was taking that long. The table to our right which showed up at least an hour after we ordered and the table behind us which showed up at least 30 minutes after we ordered both had their food brought out before ours and the only difference between those tables and us? Well, our party had 3 black people whereas the other tables were all white people.   Like I said, I won't say for sure whether we were treated crappily because of race, but really, there should be no reason whatsoever for me to even get that impression. The waitress was ok (I think her name was Brooklyn), but she should have noticed that we had been waiting for our food for, again, OVER AN HOUR and she should have done something about it. I used to wait tables back in my college days and I never would have let customers just sit for over an hour. The manager (who I'm pretty sure was drunk) should have done more than just give us 50% off of the two beer buckets we ordered. They should have been 100% off considering the HORRIBLE service and experience we had.  My alma mater sometimes has alumni events here, but I will be contacting the president of the alumni association to ensure that future watch parties and alumni events are NEVER held at this place. I have never had such a horrible experience or been treated so terribly in my life. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place like the plague.

InqqKtHyZ7xLFZ_jQ8kgkg.text: Go to Boondocks if you want the absolute worst service you can possibly experience in a bar. We ordered nachos and pepperoni bites, the nachos took over an hour and came out stone cold, the bites took another half hour and were black and burned to a crisp. We literally had to lean over the bar and stare into the bartenders faces to get their attention. I've been here a few times and the service has always been lousy. The staff just wanders around staring off into space or chatting with each other - it's hard to get a drink even when the place is mostly empty. I've given it several chances because the atmosphere, patio, etc. are all really great, but I won't be going back.

m0sHjAVVTPv7Em2SWBdR5A.text: Been sitting at the bar for 15 mins. No bartender has asked me for a drink.  They asked the Guys next to me who just walked in. Piss poor service and there were three men walking around which are no servers at all  only one bartender. I came in around 5:45 and left after being completely ignored. The people next to me had the same problem but when they asked one of the guys who isn't a bartender he gave them a drink then walked right by me.

LJKeLjtK-Ttna2tE_Ev_tw.text: I think boondocks  has a great concept it just fails on execution.  Since it is still relatively new I'm not going to be overly critical, because overall it was a good experience.   Service: 4 stars - the server was very sweet and attentive. There were a lot of people working on a Thursday night but she still managed to make sure that we had everything we needed.   Food: 3 stars- the menu was very intriguing it had a lot of unique options for a bar. Unfortunately when they came out while they looked pretty they lacked in flavor. It was like they just missed the mark on everything.   Atmosphere: I think it's great that they covered up the pool from Spanish fly and opened up the area so it could be a more fun environment, with ping-pong and other games.  The problem is they really didn't update anything else. The bathrooms are still old and dingy and weren't very well-kept.   Overall, I would compare this to a Gilligans... Kind of divey but a good place to go when you want to have a casual drink and hang out with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Boondocks Patio & Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie sandwich with burrata and pesto.

1uCvhak3r5jfDhRGNuTqjg.text: Most everything about Boondocks is just OK.   But there's one thing about this place that makes it 4 stars, and that's how FUN it is.  Ping Pong Table, Pool Table, 2 Corn Hole Setups, Jenga, Skee Ball...there's no other place in Old Town with that kind of fun atmosphere.  I honestly wouldn't recommend this place for Dinner, or really any other meal.  The food we had was just OK, as was the Service.    Just come in for Happy Hour and play some games.  You'll have a blast.  ENJOY!

uGtGB91zrlMRFEQoHuUrGQ.text: Four of us decrepit 45 year olds, went to Boondocks last night for the UFC fight.  Lots of TV's located throughout the place. The Inside is small, but they have a Great outdoor area with huge flat screen and several separate bar areas. .... After the fight, great dance music started..  We ate dinner and had drinks over a four hour period.  The nachos were good, and Even though they used liquid cheese, the nachos were not drowning in a heavy vat of fake cheese, like most places serve them, and they were topped off with delicious,  fresh, house made guacamole.   The fried Brussels sprouts were awesome!  Pretzel was large and served hot. Burger was awesome, sweet potato fries were great.... All of our food came out fresh, hot, and rather quickly.  The guys ordered  several buckets of beer each.... ****YUCK ALERT!!!!****They serve Pepsi products.... YUCK! *****.   But I infiltrated my own Diet Coke, and the waitress gave me a glass of ice. I'm the DD, so it's important I have my Diet Coke!   We got there around 7pm for the fight, stayed until around 11pm, before we walked around old town, visiting other clubs.   We left our credit card here, so ended up going back around 1am to pick it up, luckily, I had one diet Coke on reserve, so the guys ordered one more bucket of beer and us four old people sat there and people watched for another 45 minutes, thanking the LORD we were not young and broke anymore.  The music was great and the atmosphere was fun...  Nice mix of people, and a pretty even guy to girl ratio.... Nice looking crowd for the most part.  My husband said he doesn't recommend flip flops, You'll leave with sticky toes... And you won't be able to get into many of the other clubs in flip flops either....I

7NTruBctKo8-rrDs9h2yNA.text: You can bring your dog here and the vibe is laid back, chill and fun. You can also play bag, pool and the music is pretty good. It's a great neighborhood bar.

pAsovEFEVXPY1QmfD7SG7A.text: so this is the third time i've been here, but each time it's been a different bar! there is no longer a pool (thank goodness), but instead a giant dog friendly open air patio! love that. we only had a few beers here on a pub crawl, but it seemed like a friendly place...lots of good looking people.   we'll be back with our pooch next time.

9hcxbdAn1dSZ2EOdwxSy-w.text: So a small error was made in the event my debit card was accidentally given away to another patron, nightmare! However I was incredibly impressed how the situation was handled. Not only was my bar tab taken care of, Michael Kogan also gave me as well as my friends drinks as well as paying for an uber to go pick up my debit card from another bar and return it back to me before I left. In my opinion this is the epitome of customer service! So thankful the mistake was not only corrected but to feel like he really cared about returning my lost item. Fellow service industry worker approved.

TuHdc0wot5_6KEaFDF96xA.text: While patio bars and Scottsdale aren't really my favorite thing, this one is ok.  I prefer this concept to Spanish Fly, mostly because I'm not worried about me shoved into the pool if somebody stumbles into me.  Pros:  Lots of things to do.  Large bar, plenty of TVs, bags (or corn hole if you're from the Midwest), couches and tables.   The appetizers I tried were very good... the Whiskey Wings had a great, unique flavor-though I missed the ranch dressing.  The fried brussels sprouts were quite good, but almost too flavorful for a stand-alone dish... they might do better alongside an entree or salad. Service was good, considering the crowd.  They were prepared for the busy night ahead of them. It doesn't seem too difficult to get a seat ahead of a popular televised sporting event.  Cons:  The setup of our table wasn't great for watching our chosen sporting event, on only one TV at the time.  We couldn't all sit on one side of the table so it was awkward. The fan (that I acknowledge is necessary this time of year) was too high and too loud.  Men don't appreciate how annoying it is to have hair incessently blown into your face to tickle your nose no matter what you do.  I wasn't willing to sit in front of it for the hours we would be there, so the seating options were further restricted. The TVs combined with music and talking were too loud.  Even for a bar.  It was too much. The bills were delivered without the itemized copy. When the server offers to split the check, it should be automatic to itemize.  We weren't sure who got charged for which split items, and couldn't double check for accuracy.

UcyBPG5nXEtWjVf619AOTw.text: I thought this was a Cardinals bar.  Aside from the big screen, the TVs are featuring every other game. I'm here with a big group and we've asked multiple times for TVs within our eyeshot to be switched to the Cardinals game and they keep saying "Someone else is watching the game so we can't change it to the Cardinals." Unless we go and sit under the glaring sun because they don't have enough umbrellas, I won't be able to watch the game. I won't be coming back here for Cardinals games in the future. So disappointing.

OH3NGFMNtK-RCn7KQnzgCg.text: Best outdoor patio!!! Food was okay but the service was so slow. This place is more for people trying to play bags, drink beers and watch a game.

byKRj5-naXjUil_uHMLnyg.text: Came here last night and it was a lot of fun.  Boondocks has a nice patio with cornhole, some pool and best of all it is Dog Friendly! We came here for a happy hour and had some of the sleepy dog beer (so good!) and ordered some of the pretzals and I was happy with the service, food, and beer selection. I also got some water for my puppy, and they gave me a nice dog treat for him (super cute!).  So - why 4 stars and not 5 if it was a great time? Bc I don't know what sets them apart. I need to try more thing sin their menu and really see the quality of their food. But the pretzals were bomb! And puppy enjoyed his treat!

U0_ALZ9Ng9E5D6c826dLNA.text: I used to love this place until the bartender  tonight called me a bitch. I cracked a joke and he told me I was a bitch and we wouldn't serve me. He proceeded to pour himself drinks and chat it up with his buddies all night and no longer serve the bar after the moment we got there. I will no longer come back considering the amount of disrespect I received tonight.

EDngKFDA4HOgjd_6-n0MVA.text: I unapologetically love Boondocks. It's refreshingly unlike anything else in that area of old-town. The crowd is down to earth, the food is simple, and the decor is relaxed. Last Sunday my friends and I spent hours there to cool down after "Sunday Funday" at RnR. Such a good choice. The live band was amazing and we were able to pass the time by playing a variety of games, like bags. Great bonding. On Thursday nights, they have "free" poker. You're able to play for sport and without the risk of losing all your money!   Love Boondocks. Go there!

Tv4d313AcKtjo-AaIlEBjA.text: Love this place! Stuff is awesome! Always full so if you are looking gor a place to spand great time with your friend it is perfect! Better than any club in OldTown

xAg96G1zGZB7Cu4FtdzA8g.text: BAD ASS!! Mike is so funny. Very kind and keeps you on your toes. Makes the experience great! Of course... extremely HANDSOME.

EV-IV1cA5tt_tOQueNEzag.text: Great live music venue. Good food, good drinks. Stephanie is an awesome server. Kudos!

photos.caption: Photo of Boondocks Patio & Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Boonstock The Black Moods

rPa20vd4Gi_TmcNWwAe_hg.text: Boondocks is my "go to" bar in old town Scottsdale. The alcohol is cheaper than the other bars in the area and the food is very good as well.   It has a great atmosphere (both indoors and outdoors) where you can play cornhole, ping pong, pool, various arcade games, and jenga. It's the perfect place to watch sports or just hang out. I was just there for the Super Bowl and it was packed.   You have to stop here if you're looking for a cool bar that isn't your typical old town nightclub. Ask for Joe the bartender, he will take care of you and makes great drinks.

ex4YqOITkV5LeRgR69XqpA.text: This easily could be the best patio in Scottsdale, and the food is really good, too.  There are some booths inside if you want to get out of the sun.   On a Saturday afternoon before the party got started I saw some dogs taking in the sun on the patio, too. It's a good place to hang out for awhile. Misters make the patio bearable in the summer.  I recommend either the burgers (there's short rib in the grind so there's a lot of flavor, and the one with bilstered jalapenos has a burn that's not over the top) or the chicken sandwich with goat cheese. The sweet potato fries tasted fresh.

uQoEmBak47xH2CI_EUe64Q.text: I've had several fun nights here, whether it be for a concert, out for lunch or a night out with friends. They have a nice selection of fun games to play, good service and decent drinks. Fun spot and always packed on the weekends!

MJgFvDL7yqvtqKKSFQeW-Q.text: I didn't really care for this place.  Too small to have a band as the noise levels don't allow socialization.  The bar tenders always have a sour puss face and really slow.   We only ordered chips and trio dips so I am not sure how the rest of the food taste.  I will say our waitress was very nice and attentive.   The environment was prepies in their 30's & 40's reliving their frat/sorority days.

PrneISv0z_RNeqnnavoiyg.text: My Friday night spot. Great live music a drink snacks! Mini corn dogs! Kat is an unbelievable waitress she always gets me twisted

C0t9EWcpp5nNh-S6HEV2Gg.text: Best service I have ever had! Abi is the best! I have been here many times and Abi is the absolute best

CwvpUSc47fbPkgD7fInUhg.text: Awesome to hang but be careful at the line. Daniel told me to put his name. Very offensive to women and used curse words. Fun area but Daniel told me to go fuck my self so I wrote this.

IX3ej_bUMKK7AtRB81mHRw.text: Awesome and awesome.  The beers are in cans... They crush and donate the proceeds to local charities.  With being from Phoenix, more restaurant and bars need to follow suit.

6Z-TCLReS-cPMd-q_8a_Lw.text: Casual sports bar with large connected patio. It's a nice place to get away from the fancier Scottsdale bars. Lots of places to sit or stand, both inside and out.  It's easy to see the remnant layout from Spanish Fly, the previous bar that featured a large pool in the middle. I like what they did with the space - added more tables, an area for cornhole bean bag toss, and ping pong. The bar is large and wraps around with plenty of TV's. I've been here a couple times. The first was to watch a boxing match. It doesn't take long to have a drink in your hand and the standing room comfortably affords crowds.   The second time was on a Saturday morning. A couple guys wanted to have a few rounds of beers and play bags. It was warm out, so despite the outdoor fans and portable AC units, we built up a sweat. We ordered a bucket of Coors light. You get 5 cans for $16. Later we ordered some Corona's. Again, we got cans. I'm not complaining, but glass bottles would have been a nicer touch.   Sometime, I will try the food. My friends' tacos looked pretty good, and they've got a nice selection, though you can't mix and match. Overall, Boondocks is an average watering hole, with nothing particularly memorable about it. But that's not a bad thing! What it offers is a relaxed patio to grab a beer and watch some sports, preferably on a nice day. And sometimes, that's exactly what you're looking for.

Z3pnDSbX1DE6KBm20cnr8Q.text: I have been pretty excited to finally come in! If you have been to Spanish fly and Drift  you will see they kept a lot of the same things and made it their own too. Which doesn't bother me, just makes me think of memories from the past! My first date with my boyfriend was at Drift! But if you are newly 21 you will not know the similarities!   I really enjoy the openness of the patio- but I am afraid to come here summer time! It will be a hot one! I sat where the sun directly hit my eyes, which they need to get a shade for the bartenders & guests.   The staff was pretty nice. And the security was even pleasant ! So that was nice to see smiles & noticed everyone was helping each other.  It was "carb Sunday" so we enjoyed their fries & macaroni. Both awesome, fries would of been heaven if they were cooked for a little bit longer.  The place does have some extra  Scottsdale annoyance with the people that go there- but you will find that anywhere in Oldtown!  They have a bunch if different games to play with groups which I noticed everyone loved.  I will be back, and I hope a lot!

photos.caption: Photo of Boondocks Patio & Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Macaroni comes in two skillets . The fries are made with duck fat. Yum!

a2Ugul8AIUdURImfrT56jQ.text: Such a great bar! Tons of games to play, great draft selection and even the food is awesome. Matt behind the bar is literally the heart and soul of this place and is always spreading smiles, even when he's slammed. Great spot for out of towners!

jJI_5DE4RC4DXPvkptzd8Q.text: Boondocks is a Modern Sports Bar that has a really Big Patio with High Top Tables, Ping Pong tables, TVs and other Games. Many but not all the drinks on the cocktail menu feature fresh squeezed Grapefruit Juice.   They offer lots of interesting appetizers and shareable plates and they also have a Children's Menu. The menu had a wide assortment of sandwiches and all kinds of interesting burgers.   Many things sounded interesting and I went with the Bibi Burger. I was sold on the Harissa and Raisin Marmalade and ordered it being not sure about ground turkey. But it was delicious! The Turkey was cooked like it should be but was flavorful and juicy and I really liked that spicy and sweet taste with the Turkey.   My husband had the Sin Burger and it was really delicious too. It had Jalapeno Marmalade, Pickled Cabbage, Cheddar Cheese and a blistered Jalapeno on a four grind beef patty. For his side he picked the potato salad and it was good too.  The Burgers are very solid here.  I'm not sure if they offer any full dinners here as it seems to be just a very casual menu.  Service was very good.  They are open 7 days a week for 11-2am  I'd return.

photos.caption: Photo of Boondocks Patio & Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sin Burger -Four Grind Beef Burger with Potato Salad $12.00
Photo of Boondocks Patio & Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bibi Burger -Ground Turkey,Harissa, Raisin Marmalade, Lettuce and Mint Yogurt with side of Quinoa Salad $10.00

pLkZzFFcnUlQ2rpe6lOz5A.text: This place has a little but of everything for everyone. Whether you're 5 or 75, there's something for everyone. They have one of the longest happy hours in old town  (3-8 M-F) and have a great staff who enjoy their customers. I recommend to anyone looking for a family run local neighborhood bar and restaurant.

SfgEtUSGEGrnd0c0Tj-90A.text: Great dive bar for a night out. Pool tables and darts add to the fun. Also, food is a step up from typical bar food. I recommend the Mac and cheese (five different types of cheese, bacon, etc) or Cajun fried chicken tenders.

mtmwhofme9DnmivHnhWXKA.text: Great atmosphere!  Love the huge patio which had live music.  A great place for large parties!

uWKsjYpLMxBLWqmNJ-EaPw.text: I use to come here regularly and enjoyed going here but Saturday night I was treated terrible. One of the "bouncers" was using racial slurs towards my boyfriend. And the server charged my credit card two times. I will not be returning here after being treated so terribly.
